content_list.content:
Law Depot is a will-preparation service developed with a discerning eye for professionalism and offers the customer a remarkably individualized experience.


Law Depot is a cloud-based service for the production of wills. It provides customers with an easy and user-friendly method for drafting documents, as well as a decent way for them to cherry-pick what they may require. If you sign up for the yearly plan, you will save money and receive a lot more for it.


Pros


+ The annual plan is a fantastic value

+ A procedure that is simple and easy to follow


Cons


- Very expensive every month


Key Specs


· During the trial period of seven days, users may be able to finish all of their legal paperwork without incurring any costs.

· Because all the documents and services are hosted in the cloud, there is no need to download any software.

· Law Depot's products are crafted by attorneys and kept up to date consistently.

· Wills, health care directives, and small business agreements are just some of the over 150 legal documents that may be purchased from Law Depot and used anywhere in the country.


Ken Sawyer, a lawyer, had the idea to create Law Depot in 2001 to provide consumers in the United States and Canada with more affordable legal document options. The firm began by selling promissory notes, eventually developing to where it is now. Law Depot currently provides more than 150 legal papers recognized in all 50 states in the United States of America and Canada. The business claims that it has 10 million users and has helped its customers save more than $2 billion in legal bills. Keeping this in mind, it is an excellent option for anybody searching for the most reliable will maker available online.


Every document that may be downloaded from Law Depot has been crafted by a group of certified legal experts working together. The document for the last will and testament is produced using the same method as all of the other papers produced by the firm, asking the user a series of questions and then generating a unique document based on the responses to these questions. Papers about power of attorney (for example, passing over the authority of the user's funds to a family member), paperwork about healthcare directives, and documents that address a full variety of end-of-life-related concerns are also available on Law Depot's website.


Cost


Law Depot provides its customers with a limited selection of price alternatives, such as annual or monthly memberships, a pay-per-document option, and a free trial period of one week. Registering an account or browsing through their online document library does not cost anything. The unrestricted production and printing of documents are included in the yearly pre-paid membership, which costs $95.88. The monthly cost comes to $7.99.


Alternatively, when you have used up your free trial period of one week, the license will renew at $33 a month. It will include unrestricted document production and printing capabilities. It is possible to withdraw from it at any moment. Last but not least, a pay-per-document option is available at a fixed amount that ranges anywhere from $7.50 to $119. The price of this service varies according to the kind of document and the amount of time the user wants to have access to the document. The cloud is used to store every document.


Products


No software has to be downloaded to use Law Depot, which sets it apart from some of the other will-preparation tools available on the market. Users are required to maintain their Law Depot subscriptions to continue having access to the document-creation wizards and the papers themselves. Users may cancel their subscriptions at any time.


The user can generate, download, and print unlimited documents during the free seven-day trial (which needs an email address and credit card number, but there will be no costs during this time). Users are free to cancel their subscriptions at any time and are not obligated to do so. The preceding section detailed the many additional price possibilities.


Law Depot only offers one product, a membership to a database that walks customers through the process of creating documents by asking them questions at various points. Without the assistance of an experienced legal expert, any of these may be drafted, saved, downloaded, and printed off. All forms become legally binding documents if they are correctly filled out.



In addition, Law Depot provides customers with a satisfaction guarantee. Within the first fifty days after delivery, the buyer will be given a full refund if they are unhappy with the document they received. In addition, Law Depot will reimburse clients up to $10,000 for any losses they suffer due to inaccuracies made on papers provided by the organization.


Document Creation


There is an alphabetical listing of all of Law Depot's papers, and you can also search for documents based on the subject they pertain to. Simply clicking on the document's name and then adhering to the directions on the screen is all that is required to start creating a document. After that, one can save documents, download them, print them, and sign them.


Client Support


Users who have questions or want assistance may contact Law Depot by email, using the live online chat tool, going to the help center, or calling the toll-free number. Phone assistance is offered from Monday through Friday, 8 am to 7 pm Eastern Time (ET), and can provide solutions to many regularly requested issues.


Users may educate themselves on real estate, business, personal, family, and financial law via Law Depot's blog, which covers various legal issues. The online assistance section of Law Depot provides detailed explanations of each document, including its significance and the circumstances under which certain types of papers are appropriate. However, if you want the finest support, Quicken WillMaker &''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''' Trust is one of the few online will builders that even comes close to matching the assistance and direction provided by this product.


Usability


The procedure of creating documents using Law Depot is just as simple as it is with any other similar tool, with the possible exception of Rocket Lawyer. To begin, all of the input information is saved in the cloud, meaning there is no need to download any software, and everything can be accessed from any device so long as it has an internet connection. It is simple for the user to find the particular document that they want since the selection of documents is organized into categories according to the subject matter of the documents, and they may also be put into a single lengthy alphabetical list. Users are taken directly into the creative process with only a single click on the document's name.


Users are first prompted to identify the state where they are now residing before being shown a set of questions to answer. These may be finished quickly by either clicking on a bubble, ticking a box, or filling in the blank areas with the appropriate information. The user can then access, save, print, or otherwise make changes to the document once the application has compiled all of the responses and placed them in the proper sections of the page.


Spell check, a checklist of what users may require (or have given), and worksheets are some of the capabilities that are not included that are offered by competing companies; nonetheless, the interface is relatively easy to use and does not present any significant barriers to newcomers. Law Depot has maintained a stellar reputation throughout the years, earning accreditation from the Better Business Bureau (BBB) in 2003 and now holding a prestigious "A+" rating with the organization.


Who Should Think About Using Law Depot?


· Seniors who are interested in preparing their legal documents may do so.


Law Depot users access over 150 pre-formatted legal papers that may be adapted to their specific needs via the company's website. Because of this, Law Depot is an excellent choice for older citizens who wish to write their wills, health care directives, and other important papers without retaining an attorney's services.


· Seniors that are proficient in technology


Because all of Law Depot's papers are stored in the cloud, customers may use the company's services from nearly any device that has access to the internet. Seniors who are comfortable with technology and value the flexibility and independence of handling their affairs on their own may appreciate how simple and inexpensive it is to utilize the legal papers provided by Law Depot.


· Seniors Who Are Looking for a Simple and Cost-Effective Way to Draft a Will


Because they cannot pay for a legal lawyer, some elderly people put off writing a will until a later time. Law Depot provides customers a free trial period of seven days, during which they can prepare and print out their wills for notarization. This is a service that is offered without charge by a great number of senior care organizations.


What Do People Have to Say About the Law Depot?


Users in the real world give Law Depot positive reviews, on the whole. Based on the opinions of more than 5,000 verified Law Depot customers, the company has received an average rating of 4.6 stars out of a possible 5, as shown on one review website. On a well-known review website, 513 customers have given Law Depot an average rating of 3.69 stars out of 5, with five stars being the highest possible score.


Many people who gave Law Depot a positive review said they could complete the necessary legal paperwork for a cost that was a fraction of what they would have paid at a law office in their area. One of the reviewers said that the questions and alternatives presented by Law Depot were well thought out and that it was simple to personalize the papers. A senior citizen who established a revocable living trust said that the procedure was fast and simple and that an extensive explanation accompanied each step.


Most people's troubles with their subscriptions to Law Depot were the source of their complaints. After completing the first free trial period of seven days, several reviews found it annoying that they were immediately enrolled in the service's monthly plan. Others have said that it is very difficult to cancel their subscriptions and that the customer support staff is impolite and unable to assist.


What Is the Difference Between a Living Trust and a Will?


A will specifies how the grantor would distribute their assets, such as their house, investments, and any cash they may have had after their death. These assets may include any cash they may have possessed. A will is a legal document that, in most cases, has to be submitted to a probate court before anybody may read it. This is true regardless of the viewer's connection to the person who died away. A living trust, on the other hand, is a document that is enforceable under the law and that explains how a person wishes part or all of their assets to be distributed after they pass away. A living trust does not have to be submitted to a court as a will does; thus, the information contained inside it may be kept private.



Should You Go With Law Depot?


The will preparation service provided by Law Depot is very cost-effective. There is no software to purchase, and users might, in theory, finish and process their will during the free time of seven days that are allotted to them. The price of an annual, pre-paid membership comes out to $7.99 per month, making it one of the most affordable options available; however, the month-to-month option costs $33, which is much more expensive.


The interface, on the other hand, is really simple to use and provides very uncomplicated methods for generating papers and listing them in a very plain format. The questioning method is straightforward and does not include excessive difficulties; hence, it ought to be a feasible option for the majority of ordinary users who are writing a will and testament, as well as any other papers related to end-of-life planning.
